organic_results.title: Race, class, and gender in America: Narratives of opportunity among low-income African American youths
organic_results.snippet: The research literature has explored the relationship between marginalized students' perceptions of social opportunity and mobility and their academic orientation. However, little attention has been paid to the extent to which these students simultaneously represent multiple social identities and how they may differentially assess life chances in light of their different social locations. This article examines how low-income African American high school students situate race, class, and gender in the process of status attainment. In …

publication_info.summary: C O'connor - Sociology of education, 1999 - JSTOR
